snippet: After the city’s annual St. Patrick’s Day parade led to dozens of arrests last year, the mayor decided to put a stop to a ritual that had become increasingly rambunctious in recent years.
abstract: Residents of Hoboken, NJ, improvise after cancellation of the city's March 3 St Patrick's Day parade by Mayor Dawn Zimmer in reaction to increasing violence at the event in recent years; revelers turn instead to house parties and an organized pub crawl that draws thousands; city officials report that the number of arrests and injuries declined dramatically over last year's festivities.
lead_paragraph: After the city’s annual St. Patrick’s Day parade led to dozens of arrests last year, the mayor decided to put a stop to a ritual that had become increasingly rambunctious in recent years.

headline.seo: Hoboken Arrests Drop Without Annual Parade
headline.main: With Pub Crawl Replacing St. Patrick’s Day Parade in Hoboken, Arrests Drop
headline.print_headline: With Pub Crawl Replacing St. Patrick’s Day Parade in Hoboken, Arrests Drop
